intro: Trigonella cachemiriana, commonly known as Kashmir fenugreek, is a herbaceous plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, yellow flowers. Its seeds are rich in nutrients and are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. The botanical features of Trigonella cachemiriana make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
